Method Documentation

§ __attribute__()

+ ((deprecated) __attribute__

Syncs resources between Leanplum and the current app.

You should only call this once, and before start. Deprecated. Use syncResourcesAsync: instead.

§ advanceTo:()

+ (void) advanceTo: (NSString *)  state

Advances to a particular state in your application.

The string can be any value of your choosing, and will show up in the dashboard. A state is a section of your app that the user is currently in.

Parameters
stateThe name of the state.

§ advanceTo:withInfo:()

+ (void) advanceTo: (NSString *)  state
withInfo: (NSString *)  info 

Advances to a particular state in your application.

The string can be any value of your choosing, and will show up in the dashboard. A state is a section of your app that the user is currently in.

Parameters
stateThe name of the state.
infoAnything else you want to log with the state. For example, if the state is watchVideo, info could be the video ID.

§ advanceTo:withInfo:andParameters:()

+ (void) advanceTo: (NSString *)  state
withInfo: (NSString *)  info
andParameters: (NSDictionary *)  params 

Advances to a particular state in your application.

The string can be any value of your choosing, and will show up in the dashboard. A state is a section of your app that the user is currently in. You can specify up to 200 types of parameters per app across all events and state. The parameter keys must be strings, and values either strings or numbers.

Parameters
stateThe name of the state. (nullable)
infoAnything else you want to log with the state. For example, if the state is watchVideo, info could be the video ID.
paramsA dictionary with custom parameters.

§ advanceTo:withParameters:()

+ (void) advanceTo: (NSString *)  state
withParameters: (NSDictionary *)  params 

Advances to a particular state in your application.

The string can be any value of your choosing, and will show up in the dashboard. A state is a section of your app that the user is currently in. You can specify up to 200 types of parameters per app across all events and state. The parameter keys must be strings, and values either strings or numbers.

Parameters
stateThe name of the state.
paramsA dictionary with custom parameters.

§ allowInterfaceEditing()

+ (void) allowInterfaceEditing

Call this before start to allow your interfaces to change on the fly.

Needed in development mode to enable the interface editor, as well as in production to allow changes to be applied.

ofKind: (LeanplumActionKind)  kind
withArguments: (NSArray *)  args

§ deviceId()

+ (NSString *) deviceId

Returns the deviceId in the current Leanplum session.

This should only be called after [Leanplum start].

§ enableTestMode()

+ (void) enableTestMode

This should be your first statement in a unit test.

This prevents Leanplum from communicating with the server.

§ forceContentUpdate()

+ (void) forceContentUpdate

Forces content to update from the server.

If variables have changed, the appropriate callbacks will fire. Use sparingly as if the app is updated, you'll have to deal with potentially inconsistent state or user experience.

§ forceContentUpdate:()

+ (void) forceContentUpdate: (LeanplumVariablesChangedBlock)  block

Forces content to update from the server.

If variables have changed, the appropriate callbacks will fire. Use sparingly as if the app is updated, you'll have to deal with potentially inconsistent state or user experience. The provided callback will always fire regardless of whether the variables have changed.

§ handleActionWithIdentifier:forLocalNotification:completionHandler:()

+ (void) handleActionWithIdentifier: (NSString *)  identifier
forLocalNotification: (UILocalNotification *)  notification
completionHandler: (void(^)())  completionHandler 

Call this to handle custom actions for local notifications.

§ handleActionWithIdentifier:forRemoteNotification:completionHandler:()

+ (void) handleActionWithIdentifier: (NSString *)  identifier
forRemoteNotification: (NSDictionary *)  notification
completionHandler: (void(^)())  completionHandler 

Call this to handle custom actions for remote notifications.

§ handleNotification:fetchCompletionHandler:()

+ (void) handleNotification: (NSDictionary *)  userInfo
fetchCompletionHandler: ((deprecated("Leanplum calls handleNotification automatically now. If you " "implement application:didReceiveRemoteNotification:fetchCompletionHandler: in your app " "delegate, you should remove any calls to [Leanplum handleNotification] and call the " "completion handler yourself.")))  __attribute__ 

Handles a push notification for apps that use Background Notifications.

Without background notifications, Leanplum handles them automatically. Deprecated. Leanplum calls handleNotification automatically now. If you implement application:didReceiveRemoteNotification:fetchCompletionHandler: in your app delegate, you should remove any calls to [Leanplum handleNotification] and call the completion handler yourself.

+ (BOOL) hasStarted

Returns whether or not Leanplum has finished starting.

+ (BOOL) hasStartedAndRegisteredAsDeveloper

+ (NSDictionary *) messageMetadata

Returns metadata for all active in-app messages.

Recommended only for debugging purposes and advanced use cases.

§ NS_ENUM()

- (typedef) NS_ENUM (NSUInteger) 
(LPTrackScreenMode)   

LPTrackScreenMode enum.

LPTrackScreenModeDefault mans that states are the full view controller type name. LPTrackScreenModeStripViewController will cause the string "ViewController" to be stripped from the end of the state.

,   NS_REQUIRES_NIL_TERMINATION 

Gets the path for a particular resource.

The resource can be overridden by the server.

The resource can be overridden by the server.

§ onceVariablesChangedAndNoDownloadsPending:()

+ (void) onceVariablesChangedAndNoDownloadsPending: (LeanplumVariablesChangedBlock)  block

Block to call ONCE when no more file downloads are pending (either when no files needed to be downloaded or all downloads have been completed).

§ onInterfaceChanged:()

+ (void) onInterfaceChanged: (LeanplumInterfaceChangedBlock)  block

Block to call when the interface receive new values from the server.

This will be called on start, and also later on if the user is in an experiment that can update in realtime.

§ onStartResponse:()

+ (void) onStartResponse: (LeanplumStartBlock)  block

Block to call when the start call finishes, and variables are returned back from the server.

Calling this multiple times will call each block in succession.

§ onVariablesChanged:()

+ (void) onVariablesChanged: (LeanplumVariablesChangedBlock)  block

Block to call when the variables receive new values from the server.

This will be called on start, and also later on if the user is in an experiment that can update in realtime.

§ onVariablesChangedAndNoDownloadsPending:()

+ (void) onVariablesChangedAndNoDownloadsPending: (LeanplumVariablesChangedBlock)  block

Block to call when no more file downloads are pending (either when no files needed to be downloaded or all downloads have been completed).

§ pathForResource:ofType:()

+ (NSString *) pathForResource: (NSString *)  name
ofType: (NSString *)  extension 

Gets the path for a particular resource.

The resource can be overridden by the server.

§ pauseState()

+ (void) pauseState

Pauses the current state.

You can use this if your game has a "pause" mode. You shouldn't call it when someone switches out of your app because that's done automatically.

§ pushSetupBlock()

+ (LeanplumPushSetupBlock) pushSetupBlock

Get the push setup block.

§ setApiHostName:withServletName:usingSsl:()

+ (void) setApiHostName: (NSString *)  hostName
withServletName: (NSString *)  servletName
usingSsl: (BOOL)  ssl 

Optional.

Sets the API server. The API path is of the form http[s]://hostname/servletName

Parameters
hostNameThe name of the API host, such as www.leanplum.com
servletNameThe name of the API servlet, such as api
sslWhether to use SSL

§ setAppId:withDevelopmentKey:()

+ (void) setAppId: (NSString *)  appId
withDevelopmentKey: (NSString *)  accessKey 

Must call either this or setAppId:withProductionKey: before issuing any calls to the API, including start.

Parameters
appIdYour app ID.
accessKeyYour development key.

§ setAppId:withProductionKey:()

+ (void) setAppId: (NSString *)  appId
withProductionKey: (NSString *)  accessKey 

Must call either this or Leanplum::setAppId:withDevelopmentKey: before issuing any calls to the API, including start.

Parameters
appIdYour app ID.
accessKeyYour production key.

§ setAppVersion:()

+ (void) setAppVersion: (NSString *)  appVersion

By default, Leanplum reports the version of your app using CFBundleVersion, which can be used for reporting and targeting on the Leanplum dashboard.

If you wish to use CFBundleShortVersionString or any other string as the version, you can call this before your call to [Leanplum start]

§ setCanDownloadContentMidSessionInProductionMode:()

+ (void) setCanDownloadContentMidSessionInProductionMode: (BOOL)  value

Advanced: Whether new variables can be downloaded mid-session.

By default, this is disabled. Currently, if this is enabled, new variables can only be downloaded if a push notification is sent while the app is running, and the notification's metadata hasn't be downloaded yet.

§ setDeviceId:()

+ (void) setDeviceId: (NSString *)  deviceId

Sets a custom device ID.

For example, you may want to pass the advertising ID to do attribution. By default, the device ID is the identifier for vendor.

§ setFileHashingEnabledInDevelopmentMode:()

+ (void) setFileHashingEnabledInDevelopmentMode: (BOOL)  enabled

Modifies the file hashing setting in development mode.

By default, Leanplum will hash file variables to determine if they're modified and need to be uploaded to the server if we're running in the simulator. Setting this to NO will reduce startup latency in development mode, but it's possible that Leanplum will not always have the most up-to-date versions of your resources.

§ setInAppPurchaseEventName:()

+ (void) setInAppPurchaseEventName: (NSString *)  event

Sets a custom event name for in-app purchase tracking.

Default: Purchase.

§ setNetworkActivityIndicatorEnabled:()

+ (void) setNetworkActivityIndicatorEnabled: (BOOL)  enabled

Sets whether to show the network activity indicator in the status bar when making requests.

Default: YES.

§ setNetworkTimeoutSeconds:()

+ (void) setNetworkTimeoutSeconds: (int)  seconds

Optional.

Adjusts the network timeouts. The default timeout is 10 seconds for requests, and 15 seconds for file downloads.

§ setNetworkTimeoutSeconds:forDownloads:()

+ (void) setNetworkTimeoutSeconds: (int)  seconds
forDownloads: (int)  downloadSeconds 

Optional.

Adjusts the network timeouts. The default timeout is 10 seconds for requests, and 15 seconds for file downloads.

§ setPushSetup:()

+ (void) setPushSetup: (LeanplumPushSetupBlock)  block

Customize push setup.

If this API should be called before [Leanplum start]. If this API is not used the default push setup from the docs will be used for "Push Ask to Ask" and "Register For Push".

§ setShouldOpenNotificationHandler:()

+ (void) setShouldOpenNotificationHandler: (LeanplumShouldHandleNotificationBlock)  block

§ setTestModeEnabled:()

+ (void) setTestModeEnabled: (BOOL)  isTestModeEnabled

Used to enable or disable test mode.

Test mode prevents Leanplum from communicating with the server. This is useful for unit tests.

§ setTrafficSourceInfo:()

+ (void) setTrafficSourceInfo: (NSDictionary *)  info

Sets the traffic source info for the current user.

Keys in info must be one of: publisherId, publisherName, publisherSubPublisher, publisherSubSite, publisherSubCampaign, publisherSubAdGroup, publisherSubAd.

§ setUserAttributes:()

+ (void) setUserAttributes: (NSDictionary *)  attributes

Sets additional user attributes after the session has started.

Variables retrieved by start won't be targeted based on these attributes, but they will count for the current session for reporting purposes. Only those attributes given in the dictionary will be updated. All other attributes will be preserved.

§ setUserId:()

+ (void) setUserId: (NSString *)  userId

Updates a user ID after session start.

§ setUserId:withUserAttributes:()

+ (void) setUserId: (NSString *)  userId
withUserAttributes: (NSDictionary *)  attributes 

Updates a user ID after session start with a dictionary of user attributes.

§ setVerboseLoggingInDevelopmentMode:()

+ (void) setVerboseLoggingInDevelopmentMode: (BOOL)  enabled

Sets whether to enable verbose logging in development mode.

Default: NO.

§ start()

+ (void) start

Call this when your application starts.

This will initiate a call to Leanplum's servers to get the values of the variables used in your app.

§ startWithResponseHandler:()

+ (void) startWithResponseHandler: (LeanplumStartBlock)  response

Call this when your application starts.

This will initiate a call to Leanplum's servers to get the values of the variables used in your app.

Call this when your application starts.

This will initiate a call to Leanplum's servers to get the values of the variables used in your app.

+ (void) startWithUserId: (NSString *)  userId

Call this when your application starts.

This will initiate a call to Leanplum's servers to get the values of the variables used in your app.

+ (void) startWithUserId: (NSString *)  userId
responseHandler: (LeanplumStartBlock)  response 

Call this when your application starts.

This will initiate a call to Leanplum's servers to get the values of the variables used in your app.

+ (void) startWithUserId: (NSString *)  userId
userAttributes: (NSDictionary *)  attributes 

Call this when your application starts.

This will initiate a call to Leanplum's servers to get the values of the variables used in your app.

§ startWithUserId:userAttributes:responseHandler:()

+ (void) startWithUserId: (NSString *)  userId
userAttributes: (NSDictionary *)  attributes
responseHandler: (LeanplumStartBlock)  startResponse 

Call this when your application starts.

This will initiate a call to Leanplum's servers to get the values of the variables used in your app.

§ syncResourcePaths:excluding:()

+ (void) syncResourcePaths: (NSArray *)  patternsToIncludeOrNil
excluding: ((deprecated))  __attribute__ 

Syncs resources between Leanplum and the current app.

You should only call this once, and before start. Deprecated. Use syncResourcePaths:excluding:async instead.

Parameters
asyncWhether the call should be asynchronous. Resource syncing can take 1-2 seconds to index the app's resources. If async is set, resources may not be available immediately when the app starts.
patternsToIncludeOrNilLimit paths to only those matching at least one pattern in this list. Supply nil to indicate no inclusion patterns. Paths are relative to the app's bundle.
patternsToExcludeOrNilExclude paths matching at least one of these patterns. Supply nil to indicate no exclusion patterns.

§ syncResourcePaths:excluding:async:()

+ (void) syncResourcePaths: (NSArray *)  patternsToIncludeOrNil
excluding: (NSArray *)  patternsToExcludeOrNil
async: (BOOL)  async 

Syncs resources between Leanplum and the current app.

You should only call this once, and before start.

Parameters
asyncWhether the call should be asynchronous. Resource syncing can take 1-2 seconds to index the app's resources. If async is set, resources may not be available immediately when the app starts.
patternsToIncludeOrNilLimit paths to only those matching at least one pattern in this list. Supply nil to indicate no inclusion patterns. Paths are relative to the app's bundle.
patternsToExcludeOrNilExclude paths matching at least one of these patterns. Supply nil to indicate no exclusion patterns.
asyncWhether the call should be asynchronous. Resource syncing can take 1-2 seconds to index the app's resources. If async is set, resources may not be available immediately when the app starts.

§ track:()

+ (void) track: (NSString *)  event

Logs a particular event in your application.

The string can be any value of your choosing, and will show up in the dashboard. To track a purchase, use LP_PURCHASE_EVENT.

§ trackAllAppScreens()

+ (void) trackAllAppScreens

Automatically tracks all of the screens in the app as states.

You should not use this in conjunction with advanceTo as the user can only be in 1 state at a time.

§ trackAllAppScreensWithMode:()

+ (void) trackAllAppScreensWithMode: (LPTrackScreenMode)  trackScreenMode

Automatically tracks all of the screens in the app as states.

You should not use this in conjunction with advanceTo as the user can only be in 1 state at a time.

Parameters
trackScreenModeChoose mode for display. Default is the view controller type name.

Manually tracks InApp purchase and does server side receipt validation.

+ (void) trackInAppPurchases

Automatically tracks InApp purchase and does server side receipt validation.

§ userId()

+ (NSString *) userId

Returns the userId in the current Leanplum session.

This should only be called after [Leanplum start].

§ variants()

+ (NSArray *) variants

Gets a list of variants that are currently active for this user.

Each variant is a dictionary containing an id.
